sen.j: 村国 子老（むらくに の おい､生没年不明）は、日本の奈良時代の人物である。
sen.e: MURAKUNI no Oi (dates unknown) was a figure who lived during Japan's Nara period.

sen.j: 741年に讃岐国介を解任された。
sen.e: In 741 he was dismissed from his post as Assistant Governor of Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 763年に外従五位下に進み、能登守になったが藤原仲麻呂の乱に連座して処分された。
sen.e: In 763 he was promoted to outer (that is, outside the capital) junior fifth rank, lower grade (among those living outside the capital) and named the governor of Noto Province, but was implicated in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Revolt and punitively dismissed from his post and rank.

In 763 he was promoted to Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade] given to persons outside Kyoto) and named the governor of Noto Province, but was implicated in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's Revolt and punitively dismissed from his post and rank.

sen.j: 770年に元の位に復帰し、771年園池正、772年伊豆守、出雲介を歴任した。
sen.e: In 770 he was restored to his original rank, and then in 771 he was named the Jo (Director) of Gardens and Ponds before he was successively named, in 772, the governor of Izu and the assistant governor of Izumo.

sen.j: 村国氏は美濃国各務郡の豪族で、村国男依が672年の壬申の乱で功を立てたことにより、朝廷でも知られるようになった。
sen.e: The Murakuni clan was the most powerful local family in the Kakami district of Mino Province, and thanks to MURAKUNI no Oyori winning distinction in the fighting during the Jinshin War (of 672), their fame appears to have grown enough to be known to the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 子老はその係累と思われるが、系譜は不明である。
sen.e: Oi is thought to have been a descendant of Oyori's, but his actual genealogy remains unknown.

sen.j: 天平13年（741年）5月27日に、讃岐国の介、正六位上村国連子老が、越後国の掾錦部男笠とともに、解任された。
sen.e: On the 27th day of the fifth month of 741, the Companion MURAKUNI no Oi, who at that time was assistant governor of Sanuki Province and was of the senior sixth rank, upper grade, was dismissed from his post, as was NICHIKIBE no Okasa, the Jo ("Helper") of Echigo Provice.

On the 18th day of the seventh month of 741, MURAKUNI no Oi, who at that time was Sanuki no kuni no suke (Assistant Governor of Sanuki Province) and was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), was dismissed from his post, as was NICHIKIBE no Okasa, the Jo (secretary of provincial offices) of Echigo Provice.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: On the 18th day of the seventh month of 741, MURAKUNI no Oi, who at that time was Sanuki no kuni no suke (Assistant Governor of Sanuki Province) and was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade), was dismissed from his post, as was NICHIKIBE no Okasa, the Jo (secretary of provincial offices) of Echigo Provice.

sen.j: 理由は、官長に礼を失いたがいに和順しなかったからとされた。
sen.e: The reason for their dismissal is thought to have been that they failed to show gratitude to the head of government, neither taking their turn at pacification.
sen.cmt: Note that I was unable to find any information about this term "wajun suru", so was forced to guess at the translation.
sen.e: The reason for their dismissal is thought to have been that they failed to show gratitude to the head of government, with neither of them able to obey orders in a reasonable manner.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年）1月9日、子老は正六位上から外従五位下に進み、主船正に任じられた。
sen.e: On the ninth day of the first month of 763. Oi was promoted from senior sixth rank, upper grade to outer junior fifth rank, lower grade, and was appointed the Jo (Director) of the Ministry of Ships.

On the first day of the third month of 763, Oi was promoted from Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) to Ge-jugoinoge (Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) given to persons outside Kyoto), and was appointed Shusen no kami (Director of the Ministry of Ships).

sen.j: 翌8年（764年）8月4日に、能登守になった。

sen.e: No records survive of how Oi was dealt with, but it seems that he was dismissed from his post as governor of Noto and either stripped of his court rank or demoted.
